answers.answer: Hi...Well, you know the first thing you are going to hear is to stop smoking.  May or may not be related....but a good thing to do nonetheless.Have you been to your doc?Do you notice anything in particular that "triggers" your migraines?  Stress, certain foods (cheese, chocolate, caffiene), strong odors, bright lights, etc.Do you notice anything that makes them better?Have you been tested for diabetes?Any chance you are a veteran? (Just curious based on some of your symptoms).I know...tons of questions....I'm a migraine-sufferer also....have been for the past 15+ years and it does suck, no nice way to put it.

Hi....I was told I had migraines for yrs I was told this and I was dx last Feb with chiari.It is mostly reported as incidental on MRI's or not even mentioned because the radiologists and NS r not all up on the info related to this condition or other conditions that r related.Not that I think u have this , but because it can get missed....review ur reports and have ur dr look at the films to make sure this isn't a possibility.Good luckGodspeed"selma"

WELL I DID NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT U MEAN BY A 'VETERAN'.ANYWAY I HAVE GOT MY SUGAR TESTED AND HAVE FOUND IT TO BE NORMAL.ALSO BEEN TO AN OPTHAMOLOGIST AND SHE HAS ADVISED THAT THE PAIN BEHIND THE EYEBALLS IS THERE TO STAY- ONLY CURE IS COLD FERMENTATION.I HAVE TRIED TO FIND OUT WHETHER THERE IS ANY PARTICULAR TRIGGER FOR THE MIGRAINE BUT I FEEL THERE IS NONE.AS TO WHAT MAKES IT OK IS WHEN I GO OFF TO SLEEP MOSTLY.AND LASTLY THANKS FOR UR ADVICE ON SMOKING- I WILL TRY
By "veteran" I meant veteran of the military.

Have you been tested for diabetes beyond the one time you had your blood glucose levels tested (and was this a fasting or non-fasting specimen)? Joint problems are a hallmark of this disease. I also get migraines and have joint problems (and I'm only 22).....but my thyroid has been going crazy for the past year, so you might want to have a thyroid panel done next time you get bloodwork done. Are you on any medication for your migraines? I would definitely consider trying to quit smoking, namely because this could be a cause of your migraines.

question: i am a 28 year old male. Since the last 3-4 years i have developed some kind of a migraine which is not  easily understood.I get a headache in the left side of the head. My left eyeball feels like it is terribly strained. there is also a tingling/numbing sensation in the left side of the body including the jaw.I feel totally drained out and am not able to focus at all. I have stopped feeling fresh anymore and always feel like i am stressed out.This headache occurs almost everyday and might last at times for 6-8 hours at a stretch. I also have irritable bowel syndrome and a pain in all my joints of the body especially shoulder and knees.I have got an MRI done of the brain and it was normal.There is a family history of diabetics with my grandfather having it at the age of 34(died at 64).lastly i smoke around a pack a day.please give me a cure if you can.thanks
title: migraine
